titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his papers at Syracuse University

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Biographical material and writings (speeches, reviews, essays, sermons, etc) of the American clergyman.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: John Margetts Bull (1812?-1897?) was an American Methodist clergyman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
John Margetts Bull Papers consist of biographical material and photocopies of writings by Bull, including addresses, book reviews, essays, lectures, notes, reviews, and sermons. The latter constitute the bulk of the collection. They are of course religious in character, but also refer to current events and social questions of the time, such as a typhoid epidemic, the Great Rebellion (Civil War), and the characteristics of a good teacher.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has the papers of numerous clergymen as well as the records of a number of churches. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p:
Gift of
Marian Bull Wheeler, February 1988. Given in honor of her father, Charles King Bull.
